article.headline: Fauci to throw out first pitch at Washington Nationals opener on Thursday
article.body: The defending World Series champion Washington Nationals revealed on Monday that Dr. Anthony Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, would throw out the ceremonial first pitch on Opening Day of baseball's pandemic-abbreviated regular season, which runs just 60 games, versus the standard 162. The Nationals open Thursday at home against the New York Yankees. The club's announcement called Fauci a "Nats super-fan" and described him as a "true champion for our country" not only during the ongoing coronavirus crisis but "throughout his distinguished career."
